snippet: Critics of the state of emergency say the human cost of warrantless searches has been disproportionate to their efficacy.
abstract: Muslim groups point to many of French Muslims who have been placed under house arrest in wake of Paris terrorist attacks as evidence of how security concerns are eclipsing civil liberties under state of emergency declared by Pres Francois Hollande; authorities have many expanded powers, including ability to place people under house arrest without any proof of wrongdoing, as they have done with blind 21-year-old Daoud Muradyan; Muradyan's case offers window into challenges country faces at it seeks to prevent another attack.
lead_paragraph: Critics of the state of emergency say the human cost of warrantless searches has been disproportionate to their efficacy.

headline.main: Muslims in France Say Emergency Powers Go Too Far
headline.print_headline: French Muslims Say Emergency Powers Come at Too High a Cost

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
